items.description: River Thame, Horsenden Stream and Chalgrove Brook

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thame, Horsenden Stream, Chalgrove Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels are rising on the River Thame as a result of recent rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected today, 07/07/2024, especially in the Thame area. 

Further rain is forecast today which has the potential to be heavy at times. This evening and overnight will be mainly dry. We expect river levels to continue slowly rising this morning and levels will remain sensitive to further rainfall. 

We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. 

This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 08/07/2024, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels are high but steady on the River Coln as a result of recent rainfall. Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected today, 07/07/2024, especially in the Fairford area. 

Further rain is forecast today which has the potential to be heavy at times. This evening and overnight will be mainly dry. We expect river levels to remain high over the coming days and will be sensitive to further rainfall. 

We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. 

This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 08/07/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower River Colne and Frays River

floodArea.county: Buckinghamshire, Greater London, Hertfordshire, Hillingdon, Slough, Surrey, Windsor and Maidenhead

items.message:
River levels are rising on the Lower River Colne due to heavy rainfall today, Saturday 6th July. 
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Colne, Frays, Wraysbury and Poyle Channel, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around Longford.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Sunday 7th July, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. Levels have risen on the Upper River Loddon as a result of a period of sustained rain, but have now stabilised and are slowly starting to fall. Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected today 07/07/24, especially in the Sherfield on Loddon area. Further rainfall, which may be heavy at times, is forecast over the next 24 hours. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. We are monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 08/07/24, or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels this morning may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible when river levels are at their highest between 12:30 PM and 2:30 PM on 07/07/2024.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Alt, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around River Alt and other watercourses from Huyton to Hightown including, Kirkby, Fazakerley, Maghull, Formby, Aughton, Sefton and Lunt.
Weather conditions are expected to improve this afternoon and no further flooding is expected.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 6:00 PM on 07/07/2024, or as the situation changes.
